remarks: The domain of a nonzero linear operator contains a nonzero vector. (Contributed by NM, 15-Dec-2007.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
lnon0.1 $e |- X = ( BaseSet ` U ) $.
lnon0.6 $e |- Z = ( 0vec ` U ) $.
lnon0.0 $e |- O = ( U 0op W ) $.
lnon0.7 $e |- L = ( U LnOp W ) $.
lnon0 $p |- ( ( ( U e. NrmCVec /\ W e. NrmCVec /\ T e. L ) /\ T =/= O ) -> E. x e. X x =/= Z ) $.
$d L x $.
$d T x $.
$d U x $.
$d W x $.
$d X x $.
